text.p: These are some of the leading stories in Kuwait's press on Monday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- New advertising media network to start broadcasting in Kuawit's major shopping centres in March 1997.
- Five MPs present bill to amend 1961 law to allow licences for new newspapers. Kuwait currently has five Arabic and two English-language dailies.
- Vatican Foreign Minister Tuaran thanks Kuwait during his visit for well treating 100,000 Catholics residing in the Moslem Gulf Arab state.
- Kuwait Stock Exchange index rises 13.7 points to 1,919.8.
- Human rights parliamentary panel calls for the release of Kuwaitis detained in Iraq since 1990-91 Gulf crisis. Kuwait says some 600 of its citizens are held in Iraq.
- Prime Minister briefs cabinet on his visit to the United Arab Emirates.
- Some 50 percent of Kuwaitis are prone to allergies.
- Real estate market picks up in Kuwait.
- Iraq blocks work of United Nations weapons inpectors in charge of eliminating Baghdad's mass destruction arms.
